immediately, please contact area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-6992.

• There was no consultation requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: The
agency had four areas of noncompliance identified as a part of the interim
evaluation completed on 2/13/25. Areas identified in noncompliance were
422(3)(e), 418(2)(b), 413(1)(c)(ii), and 605(3)(k). The CAP for these areas was
approved on 5/01/25 and was successful as none of the areas were identified as
repeat noncompliance as a part of this renewal evaluation.
Chief Administrator Assessment

The Chief Administrator Annual Assessment included a review of the action steps
related to the areas of noncompliance identified in interim evaluation completed on
2/13/2025. An identified challenge related to establishing compliance and
completing the action steps included maintaining adequate staffing with progress
being noted.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget and the agency's financial audit.
Staff Interviews
Child Welfare Staff participated in entrance and exit conferences. Staff interviews
did not identify any areas of concern.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency maintains sufficient office space, equipment and supplies to ensure
delivery of foster care, independent living, licensing and adoption services. All files
were stored securely and there is a cross shredder for CHRI. The agency is
currently in the process of expanding their administrative offices to assist staff in
the continuation of services.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were 3 safety concerns identified.
Safety Alert #1: The home needed additional smoke detectors.
Resolution: Smoke detectors were provided and installed with picture verification.
Safety Alert #2: The home needed additional smoke detectors.
Resolution: Smoke detectors were provided and installed with picture verification.
Safety Alert #3: The home needed additional smoke detectors.
Resolution: Smoke detectors were provided and installed with picture verification.

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their
regular license.
